result.execSummary:
The defendant David Michael Husmann #315266 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Michael Husmann #315266 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Michael Husmann #315266 was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • David Michael Husmann #315266 was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for time served of 8 days as calculated by the Bayfield County Sheriff's Dept.

Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.
Concurrent with: existing probation

miscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $654.00.  Cash bond applied.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Defendant is to undergo cognitive behavior counseling and any other counseling as recommended by Agent.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or drugs, except for medications as prescribed by a physician and taken only as prescribed.  Not to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.    As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.
Subject to random UAs and testing.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

This bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.    We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.

The warrant will be quashed once the full cash bail has been posted.  Amended 4-1-2016:  Cash bond amended to $1,250.00.  All other conditions of the bond remain in effect.

Amended cash bond set

Defendant David Michael Husmann in court with attorney Vincent Kurta.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:25 p.m.  Atty Kurta was able to contact his client and have him come into court, his hearing had been set for 10:00 a.m. and client missed court and WA was issued.  Court:  questions why Mr. Husmann is so late for Court.  Atty Kurta responds; asks WA be quashed.  Court talks with defendant.  Kurta asks for a PH be set.  DA responds; PH had been scheduled 02-25-2016 and Mr. Husmann was present when PH set; he has posted $1,000.00 c/b with conditions; asks for additional c/b and be tested today; open cases in another county for drugs.  Defendant indicates 43185 Cavanaugh Rd, Cable, WI 54821 is updated address.  
Court:  orders additional $1,500.00 c/b; WA will be quashed once the additional c/b is posted.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
BODY ONLY
Minutes Filed
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on March 15, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. issued to A.R.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance for witness to appear and give evidence on March 15, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. issued to T.R.

Defendant David Michael Husmann in court with attorney Vincent Kurta.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's motion for leave to file amended information; Kurta rec'd copy of motion and requests PH.  DA responds; basis for motion to amend is that the firearm he was in possession of was actually stolen.  Thus, the need to amend the charge.  Court, if defense is asking for PH on amended charge, will grant.  Kurta requests PH on all matters.  Court grants request for PH.  Court continues bond in this matter.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
